title: BNY Mellon, Google Develop AI to Spot Treasury Trade Fails
sub_head: AI technology is aimed at the $20 trillion Treasury market where some 2% of transactions fail to settle on a typical day
body:
Bank of New York Mellon Corp., working with Google Cloud, has developed machine-learning technology that is designed to predict when Treasury market trades will fail to settle.
Treasury securities are traded by broker-dealers, institutional investors, banks and others. There are a number of reasons U.S. Treasury trades can fail, such as if one party is short the securities needed to complete a trade, a computer system goes down, or because of some other operational issue, according to the custody bank.
